blocks.text: An insider threat originates from individuals who already have legitimate access to organizational systems, such as employees, contractors, or partners.
Malicious insiders intentionally misuse access to steal data, sabotage systems, or sell information.
Negligent insiders create risk by ignoring security policies, falling for phishing attacks, or mishandling sensitive data.
Because insiders operate within trusted environments, their actions can be harder to detect using traditional perimeter defenses.
